intro: Cephalaria glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive blooms and hardy nature.
